title: "Working with model documentation"

After you have uploaded documentation through the developer framework, you can use the Platform UI to make qualitative edits to model documentation, view  guidelines, collaborate with validators, and submit your model documentation for approval. 

::: {.callout-important}
## Looking to get started with uploadng learn how to use the developer framework?

[registered in the model inventory](register-models-in-model-inventory.qmd)

:::

## Prerequisites

* You hold the `Developer` role 
* The model is already [registered in the model inventory](register-models-in-model-inventory.qmd)
* You have provided some content fir the documentation, either [by uploading it through the ValidMind Developer Framework](get-started-developer-framework.qmd) or via the online UI editor
* You have already located the project identifier, API key and secret
* You have already initialized the developer framework for your model

## Steps

1. [Log in to the ValidMind UI]({{< var vm_ui >}}).

2. In the left sidebar, click [**Model Inventory**](https://app.prod.validmind.ai/model-inventory).

3. Select a model by clicking on it or find your model by applying a filter or searching for it.

4. In the left sidebar that appears for your model, click **Documentation**.

   You can now jump to any section of the model documentation by expanding the table of contents on the left and selecting the relevant section you would like to view.

5. In any section of the documentation, hover over text content and click the {{< fa edit >}} edit icon that appears on the right of the textbox. 
<!--- **Need image** --->

    You can now use the text editor functions to edit the content of the section.

6. Save your edits when done by clicking on the {{< fa save >}} save icon to the right of the textbox to save your changes.

::: {.column-margin}
::: {.callout-tip}
The section activity at the bottom of the page records a new event every time edits are made to the contents of the page.
:::
:::
